title: High Ping with recent updates
body: So living in a suburb of Chicago (where the main server is) me and my friends usually got low ping for example i got the highest ping of my friends at an average of 35 ms and my friend with the lowest ping got 12 ms and the best ever of 9 ms but after the preseason patch me and a few of my friends have been hitting super high ping like 600ms but heres the the thing only people with mediacom internet are getting high ping so at first i thought that mediacom was the problem but my freinds who play csgo and overwatch arnt getting this problem so after thinking about this issue for awhile i thought that my dns settings may be the problem so after switching my dns settings to riots recommended settings and restarting my computer i got my ping to go back to 60ms which isnt bad because i remember the day of 120ms anyways riot can you help me and my friends with this situation?

replies.body:
It definitely sounds like this is caused by Mediacom enacting traffic rerouting during peak hours in order to mitigate network congestion, resulting in affecting latency to the League servers. I'd recommend running a traceroute log during the hours you experience high latency so we can see what's going on in the backend. First, grab the network app [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) then plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field before you start the trace. After 5 minutes has passed by, export the results as text and paste them in a reply.

Let me know if you encounter issues with this.
